title: Master Data Analyst
description:
Job Description:

Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.

“For more than 30 years at 3M, I’ve seen firsthand how it’s a place where curious, creative and collaborative people thrive and build a rewarding career. As a leader in this company, my goal is to ensure each 3Mer sees and feels the positive impact we’re making around the world” – Mike Roman, chief executive officer and chairman of the board at 3M

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Master Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and... diverse people around the world.

Here, you will make an impact by:
• Responsible for creating and updating master data components for 3M materials in SAP system
• Executing tasks according to data governance rules and standard work
• Responsible for: monitoring & execution of tasks in assigned work queue ; completing assigned tasks within SLA targets
• Identification of opportunities to improve data quality, process efficiency or reduce cycle time
• Cooperation with other functions or business groups to resolve issues within E2E process
• May include participation in project management or workshops to improve process or operational efficiency

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
• At least 1 year of equivalent work experience & English on communicative level
• Previous experience working with SAP preferred & Proficient in MS Excel
• Analytical mindset & detailed oriented and enjoys working with operational processes
• Previous experience working with data quality, master data management and/or data governance within a global master data environment or familiarity working with Supply Chain processes and data, manufacturing or materials management preferred but not required
• Collaborative Team player

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope. 
• Private medical care
• Life insurance
• Retirement scheme
• Multisport card
• Opportunity to work globally as part of an international organization
• Work in a respectful, inclusive and friendly environment with open door policy
• Professional training and onboarding package
• Supporting your professional development, possibility to gain certifications/co-founding studies
• Supporting your work-life balance through being a part of community groups, CSR actions, volunteering
• Internal integration events
• Holiday Bonus
• At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.
If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit
Dowiedz się więcej o naszych innowacyjnych rozwiązaniach na: approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. Our global Work Your Way initiative gives our employees flexibility in where and how their work can be performed, subject at all times to any location-specific rules and policies that may be in place from time to time (more information on such rules/policies can be provided upon request from the relevant in-location HR.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here , select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms

title: Operations Analyst
description:
Duties:
• Analyzes, troubleshoots, and resolves network alerts.
• Follows knowledge articles to provide support for these systems.
• Works effectively with cross-function teams of IT professionals to troubleshoot these systems.
• Tracks the resolution of all issues.
• Works with ISPs and other service providers to create, escalate and resolve support issues. Coordinates remotely with local site contacts to troubleshoot and resolve circuit issues.
• Escalates critical issues appropriately to the NOC Shift Supervisor and support teams.
• Completes project related tasks as assigned by the NOC Shift Supervisor.

Our requirements:
• Basic knowledge of telecommunication systems, such as network architectures, IP voice, data, wireless, internet technologies etc.
• Experience or expertise in Cisco IOS
• Strong written communication skills, including the ability to document operations procedures.
• Strong verbal communications skills, including professional customer service skills and the... ability to effectively deal with hardware and software vendors when troubleshooting problems.

Nice to have:
• A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or studying in one of those disciplines.
• Experience or expertise in at least one of the following: SD-WAN, Cisco Meraki, Cisco VoIP and Avaya telephony, Citrix Netscaler Load-Balancers, NxOS, Meraki networking, Palo Alto NGFW.
• A strong understanding of DNS architecture, IP subnets, and Routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, and EIGRP).
• Courses and Certification: CCENT, CCNA, CCNP, ITIL.
• Former experience with network monitoring

ABOUT US:

Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.

PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD

Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company.. To learn more, visit [...] follow @ PPG on Twitter.

The PPG Way

Every single day at PPG:

We partner with customers to create mutual value.

We are insightful, dedicated and proactive. We have intimate knowledge of the market and our customers. We focus on practical solutions that make a difference.

We are “One PPG” to the world.

We are better and stronger together. We leverage our scale to reach new markets and introduce innovative technologies as we differentiate and disrupt our markets.

We trust our people every day, in every way.

We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable.

We make it happen.

We have a passion for winning. We achieve. We deliver with discipline and integrity. We bring our best energy to our work. We decide and act intelligently and quickly.

We run it like we own it.

We respect one another by being responsible and accountable. We always act in the best interest of our company, customers, shareholders and our communities.

We do better today than yesterday – everyday.

We continuously learn. We develop our people to grow our businesses.

PPG vision: [...] are One PPG: [...] provides equal opportunity to all candidates and employees. We offer an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
You have:

• solid knowledge of data management principles and processes
• hands on knowledge of data governance and data profiling tools (e.g., Collibra, SQL, IDQ)
• business analysis and data wrangling (transforming and mapping) experience
• ability to break down complex problems into components, identify root causes, and establish resolution plans
• excellent presentation and communication (orally and written) skills
• proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word
• ideally 5+ years of business analyst experience with 3+ years in the data related projects
• ability to effectively communicate complex concepts and adapt to change and to detect and respond to evolving business needs

You are:
• team player, collaborative and inclusive
• analytical and logical
• highly motivated self-starter with ability to work independently and creatively as well as within a team
• LI-UBS

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst I
description:
At Jamf, people are at the core of everything we do. We do what’s right for our customers, our employees, our communities and our world. We take pride in simplifying technology for tens of thousands of customers around the globe and helping organizations succeed with Apple.

Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose to work in the office, connect 100% remote from your home, or find the blend that works best for you.

What you’ll do at Jamf:

At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. Business Intelligence at Jamf administers and manages data used for reporting and visibility at Jamf. This includes creation, management, and ongoing support for growing systems at Jamf. The Data Analyst is an integral member of the Business Intelligence team, providing analytics and visibility for key business functions at Jamf.

The Business Intelligence Data Analyst collaborates with members of the primary business functions to provide key insights, reports... and visibility to the goals of the organization. They work with the leaders of the key business functions to understand data visibility needs and create effective ways to share that data on a regular basis. The Business Intelligence Data Analyst works in conjunction with members of the Business Intelligence team to create, adapt, and grow our access and availability of data based on the needs of the organization.

This role is remote in Poland. We are only able to accept applications for those based in Poland or have sponsorship to live and work in Poland.

Responsibilities:
• Maintain an understanding of the data visibility needs of the business.
• Collaborate with other Data Analysts and business leaders in multiple business functions to understand visibility/reporting needs.
• Identify and find solutions to provide required visibility for the business.
• Create engaging, accurate, and effective visibility to key business metrics.
• Prioritise efficiency and speed to delivery, iterating on reporting and visibility solutions.
• Ensure accuracy of data reporting and visibility tools.
• Aid in the creation and growth of our data warehouse.
• Understand the data collection needs of the business.
• Collaborate with Data Quality Analyst to provide feedback on datasets and potential inaccuracies.
• Collaborate with members of Business Operations to create new data collection end points.
• Monitor and provide solutions to issues submitted through the Business Operations ticketing system.
• Maintain a high customer satisfaction score on all engagements via tickets.
• Maintain an understanding of the responsibilities of departments within the Business Operations team.
• Participate in all Business Intelligence team meetings
• Perform the role of a Data stewards to improve data health, quality, and governance
• Understand and execute within the data quality metrics set by the Data stewards
• Assist data quality initiatives by creating solutions to enforce data governance policies
• Assist data quality initiatives by automated transformation of errant data
• Maintain an understanding of the data creating business processes
• Collaborate with Data Analysts to create innovative ways to deliver data and insights to internal customers
• Monitor and assist in issue resolution from our service desk.

Skills & Requirements:
• Experience in a customer centric environment (Required).
• Synthesising many requests to create a solution that address all needs (Required).
• Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Engineering, Technology, Mathematics, or related field (Required).
• A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered.
• Fluency in English.
• Strong Communication Skills.
• Highly Organised and detail-oriented.
• Creation of data reports and visibility solutions for business functions (Preferred).
• Leveraging visual data analysis tools e.g., Domo, Tableau, etc (Preferred).
• Experience with systems and data analysis (Preferred).

How we help you reach your best potential:
• Named a Fortune Best Workplace in Technology, 2021.
• We know that big ideas can come from anyone, so we empower everyone to make an impact. Our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
• You will have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 60,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
• We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
• Our volunteer time off allows employees to support and give back to our communities.
• We encourage you to simply be you. We constantly seek and value different perspectives to ensure Jamf is a place where everyone feels comfortable and can be successful.
• 23 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
• Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.

What is a Jamf?

You go above and beyond for others, are willing to help, and support the team around you. You value and learn from different perspectives. You are curious and resourceful, a problem-solver, self-driven and constantly improving. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You are someone who cares about doing the right thing.

What does Jamf do?

Jamf extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. We believe the experience of using a device at work or school should feel the same, and be as secure as, using a personal device. With Jamf, IT and security teams are able to confidently manage and protect Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV devices, easing the burden of updating, deploying and securing the data used by their end-users. Jamf’s purpose is to simplify work by helping organizations manage and secure an Apple experience that end-users love and organizations trust.

We are free-thinkers, can-doers and problem crushers with a passion for helping customers empower their workforce to focus on their jobs, not the hassles of managing technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We have over 2,500 employees worldwide who are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each and every day.

Get social with us and follow the conversation at #OneJamf

title: Corporate Treasury - Regulatory Data Business Analyst - Associate
description:
ABOUT J.P. MORGAN CHASE & CO

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, offering solutions to the world™s most important corporations, governments and institutions in more than 100 countries. We have a sophisticated local market presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa which is complemented by staff around the world who support our growth and serve our clients 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. We are looking for collaborative, innovative and dedicated individuals to join our London team.

Organization Description

The Treasury and the Chief Investment Office (TCIO) within JPMorgan is responsible for firm wide asset and liability management for one of the world™s largest global financial institutions with a $2.5 trillion balance sheet, including more than $900 billion in loans and $1.4 trillion in deposits. Because it sits at the very centre of the firm, TCIO directly influences the composition of the firm™s balance sheet as well the activities of the firm™s four main... lines of business (LOBs): Asset & Wealth Management, Commercial Banking, Corporate & Investment Bank, and Consumer & Community Banking.

Business Description:

The Capital Change team within the TCIO function is responsible for maintaining the infrastructure required to support the calculation and reporting of Capital and other Capital-related disclosures such as Leverage, Large Exposures, CCAR, ICCAP etc. The team partners closely across JPMC functions including Technology, Capital Management, Capital Production & Operations and Lines of Business to deliver key priorities for the Firm including the implementation of ongoing regulatory changes and the development of a new reporting and analytics application.

Strategic data souring and consumption

The Strategic data souring and consumption team is responsible for leading the alignment to strategic data sources, calculation engines and reporting tools, as well as tracking readiness of critical deliverables with a senior management focus.

Job Title Regulatory Data Business Analyst

We are looking for a candidate for the role of Regulatory Data Business Analystto join the Keyword: consumer%20banking

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world™s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants™ and employees™ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we™re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

Global Finance & Business Management works to strategically manage capital, drive growth and efficiencies, maintain financial reporting and proactively manage risk. By providing information, analysis and recommendations to improve results and drive decisions, teams ensure the company can navigate all types of market conditions while protecting our fortress balance sheet

title: Institutional Credit Management - Senior Lending Data Remediation...
description:
We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

The Institutional Credit Management (ICM) group is looking for a full-time SVP to join its Wholesale Lending Credit Risk (WLCR) data management and remediation team. ICM has been established with the objective to provide an integrated “end-to-end” credit underwriting, identification, measurement, management and monitoring for wholesale credit businesses across the enterprise.

The Data Quality and Governance organization within ICM is responsible for driving a data architecture in order to deliver front to back design, identify gaps, and implement a robust governance framework across ICG Wholesale Credit Risk (WCR) universe with a specific focus on counterparty credit risk. A key focus is on Data Quality including ensuring completeness... accuracy and timeliness across data flows and alignment with Citi’s overall data strategy.

The function is responsible for extensive partnering across all relevant businesses within ICG and Independent Risk to drive key initiatives and associated deliverables for the data strategy and manage change with the right governance framework.

Key Responsibilities:
• Drive key data programs across asset classes and manage scorecard structure across completeness and standards adoption.
• Lead data remediation efforts through a mix of tactical and strategic solution design.
• Support downstream consumption plans with back office technology partners to ensure completeness and consistency throughout data flows.
• Prepare senior management level presentations to communicate strategy, programs and month over month progress.
• Act as a change agent to implement best practices and ensure transparency and consistency across teams.
• This position is expected to have people management responsibilities.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• 7 or more years of relevant work experience including data analytics.
• Data and Results oriented with an excellent attention to detail.
• Experience working closely with technology teams.
• Strong knowledge of issue management using JIR.
• Experience in interacting across multiple teams and with direct and informal management.
• Strong sense of urgency and ability to manage multiple competing priorities while delivering results quickly and efficiently.
• Exceptional level of motivation and diligence coupled with excellent communication skills (verbal and written), as well as strong relationship building skills.
• Strong ability to influence, drive direction and results.
• Highly analytical individual with the ability to work independently when needed and exemplary documentation skills.
• Ability to focus on high quality work while under pressure.

We offer:
• Work in a challenging area of the financial industry with one of the world's leading companies with exposure to variety of products, processes and controls.
• Cooperation with a high quality, international, multicultural and global team.
• Work in a friendly and diversified environment, appreciating differences in style and perspective and using them to add value to decisions leading to organizational success.
• Management supporting balanced and agile work (flexible working hours, home office).
• Attractive benefits package (Benefit System, medical care, pension plan etc.).
• A chance to make a difference with various affinity networks and charity initiatives.

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: HR Data Analyst
description:
HR Data AnalystYour responsibilities
• Responsibility for monitoring HR metrics, analysing data for trends, patterns and issues and presenting conclusions influencing business decisions
• Understanding and gathering business needs for data insights
• Taking care of data accuracy, compiling HR data from a variety of sources i.e. payroll data, employee surveys, external benchmarks and other
• Visualizing the data – developing dashboards and reports in BI tools
• Preparing Compensation & Benefits analysis
• HRIS project participation
Our requirements
• Proven experience with Power BI
• Good knowledge of SQL
• Great communication and interpersonal skills that allow to effectively work with the internal clients
• Good communication skills in the English language (B2+)
• Analytical skills
• Experience in HR will be your advantage but is not crucial
• Readiness to work on an employment replacement contract (~1 year)
What we offer
• We offer strong community support from our Data & AI Team
•... You will cooperate on a daily basis with a People & Culture Team happy to share domain expertise, i.e. HR Business Partners Compensation & Benefits Lead and Recruitment Team
• We guarantee independence and development opportunities
Benefits
• Great Place to Work' Certificate
• Working remotely or at the Wrocław/Gdańsk office
• Contract for an indefinite period from day one

• Private investment fund

• Multisport card that can be exchanged for Cafeteria System
• Development within working hours (8 days/year)

The type of contract shall depend on the actual rules of cooperation established between us during the recruitment process. Only employees are entitled to benefits package.
Objectivity sp. z o.o.

Objectivity is a values-driven IT outsourcing partner. We are Digital Transformation Specialists who create Win-Win solutions for all our stakeholders. Our specialty is designing, delivering and supporting IT solutions that help our clients grow. As a mature organisation, we have an ethical framework that supports our activities. We are socially engaged, and always willing to help

title: DRM Data Analyst
description:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION

Our company is transforming the way in which it manages rights and obligations and the product creation and maintenance processes in its market data business. That transformation, led by the Rights Management team, relies on a business information architecture that provides the blueprint for business information management, process change and capability development.

As a result of expansion of the transformation programme we are now seeking a data analyst to support the information architecture elements of the work. The data analyst will be guided by the lead information architect and provide key deliverables to product managers and others in support of the programme's goals and milestones.
RESPONSIBILITIES

The role's main responsibilities and deliverables include the following:
• Analysis of product and service metadata in existing business and technical systems.
• Mapping of product and service metadata to the established business information metamodel and... specifying extensions to that metamodel as required.
• Design of core components of business processes and of user interfaces.
• Delivery of requirements specifications (including metadata mappings, system use cases etc) into the software development process.
• Provide support to the engineering team during the software development process.
• Answer queries (on metadata, its mapping and the business information metamodel, system capabilities) from team members (product managers, product owners, business analysts, developers, business and technical SMEs) and others.
• Presentation of analysis, designs and requirements to team members and others.
SKILLS

MUST

The ideal candidate will be skilled and experienced in data analysis. Technical experience and knowledge will include:
• The software development life cycle.
• Specification and development of system capabilities in on-line service provider industries, finance, or telecommunications.

Personal characteristics:
• Highly collaborative - experience of working across horizontal teams.
• Excellent communication skills, able to engage stakeholders.
• Hands-on.
NICE TO HAVE
• Familiarity with financial market and reference data (preferred).
• University-level education in relevant subject (preferred).
CAREER AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
• Competitive salary
• Luxoft Training Center
• Access to e-learning Library
• Individual development plans
• Long-term cooperation with possibility to gain experience in different projects and technologies
• A significant number of professional communities (Agile Community, Tech Community, Business Analysis Community, etc.)
Well-being
• Group Life Insurance
• Private healthcare insurance – LuxMed. Unlimited access to specialist consultations with Dental Care included
• Medical costs reimbursement for employees (up to certain amount per quarter)
• Travel Insurance
• Benefit Program - Cafeteria and Multisport Card
Work-Life Balance
• Various communities (sport, recreation activities, trips, board games, cultural and educational activities)
• Discounts program for employees – BeLux (banking offer, car leasing offer and cafeteria program discount)
• Convenient locations in a modern offices with game rooms
• Multinational projects for clients all over the world

title: Payroll Data Analyst
description:
Payroll Data AnalystMiejsce pracy: WarszawaYour responsibilities
• Lead all payroll data management tasks for the project including collection, mapping, migration, validation, analysis, and testing.
• Ensuring an up-to-date and accurate database of employee's compensation data is maintained and that relevant data is provided to key stakeholders and third parties as required.
• Interpret payroll data.
• Evaluate risks and predict potential problems with data integrity.
• Collaborating internally with the Global Mobility Team, Local Payroll Teams, Finance Team, and Global Benefits Team to ensure timeliness and accuracy for payroll processing.
• Conduct analysis, data manipulation, reconciliation, and consolidation.
• Demonstrate ability to maintain highly confidential information.
Our requirements
• A proven track record in data analysis, data modeling, data planning, and data reporting.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills – English at C1/C2 level.
• Previous experience... in processing global payroll.
• Thorough knowledge of HR/Payroll processes and data points.
• Proficiency in the use of tools such as MS Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.)
• Be a critical thinker who can work autonomously and as part of a team.
• Accuracy and attention to the details.
• Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Optional
• Knowledge of global payroll including tax and social security treatment.
• Knowledge of Global Mobility policy and processes.
• Knowledge of any other foreign languages except English.
What we offer

International working environment.

Full-time employment contract with salary corresponding to qualifications.

Transportation allowance.

Hybrid work model.

Independent role and flexible working hours.

Benefits package including Generali life insurance, pension plan, Luxmed healthcare, Multisport card, Edenred lunch card.

Additional vacation days.

Continuous professional development and global career opportunities.
Benefits
• sharing the costs of sports activities
• private medical care
• sharing the costs of foreign language classes
• sharing the costs of professional training & courses
• life insurance
• remote work opportunities
• flexible working time
• fruits
• integration events
• corporate gym
• retirement pension plan
• corporate credit card
• video games at work
• coffee / tea
• drinks
• parking space for employees
• leisure zone
• meal passes
• sharing the costs of tourist services
• holiday funds
• sharing the costs of holidays for kids
• christmas gifts
• employee referral program
• opportunity to obtain permits and licenses
• charity initiatives
• extra leave
• annual bonus
• glasses reimbursement
• business travel insurance
• Work anniversary award
AstraZeneca Pharma

At AstraZeneca every one of our employees makes a difference to patient lives every day. In Finance, you may not feel you're at the frontline of research but your role in changing patients' lives is critical. Our mission is ambitious and it takes the skills of a collaborative team to really deliver on what science can do and to always put patients first.

AstraZeneca's Finance function is on a transformation journey with the objective of delivering excellence in financial operations and insight. As this strategy continues to drive the effectiveness and performance of the business, best in class finance support and leadership becomes ever more important.

AstraZeneca has an opportunity for an Intercompany Supply Chain Forecasting Analyst to join the Treasury Front Office team as part of the wider Group Treasury function based in our Warsaw office. Working within a collaborative team you will be responsible for forecasting the Group intercompany Foreign Exchange (FX) exposures across multiple currencies and territories, with annual exposures of c.$24bn.

The role requires an individual to have a good attention to detail, communication skills and overall knowledge of supply chains and AZ systems.

The Group Treasury team is currently made up of 19 individuals, supporting the AstraZeneca Group on all Treasury matters. The role and current size of the core Treasury team provides an excellent opportunity to directly contribute to the Treasury function of a global FTSE 10 company.

Group Treasury has recently won two Team of the Year awards, presented by both the ACT and Treasury Today

title: Senior Solution Analyst- GAMMA Retail Catalyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Sr. Analyst for the GAMMA Retail Catalyst product will play a critical role in delivering, implementing, and supporting BCG's client-facing software solutions – independently taking direction from and guiding strategic approach with senior business leaders in our Retail and Pricing sectors as well as the Product Managers for GAMMA Retail Catalyst, AIR, and other GAMMA product teams. Key activities will include gathering requirements from internal and external clients, advising them on the application's usage best practices, and recommending processes to optimize the business value delivered by the application; then sourcing and preparing data, managing required client processes changes, overseeing deployment by setting up and configuring the application according to the requirements, and training client's end users. The Analyst will interact directly with both BCG case team members and clients and must understand and be able to navigate the clients' data and... requirements. He or she should be able to quickly learn methodologies and approaches used in GAMMA Retail Catalyst, understand the industry / client context, and learn analytical approaches used to transform data into business insights. The Analyst should also be able to work with the BCG team and clients to co-create new approaches for further development of software solutions. On the solution deployment side he or she must be able to determine what is needed for compliance with the client's business needs, security policies, deployment, and support, and leverage the right tools and resources to complete the implementation with the highest level of customer satisfaction. When confronted with technical challenges, he or she must work with the BCG platform team and (working together) find creative, economical, and scalable solutions within the application's technical specifications.
YOU'RE GOOD AT

Client Requirements, Business Processes Change, Data and Analytics Management, Application Setup
• Works together with the BCG client team and the Retailer (either, the “customer”) to understand client's processes, business requirements, and data structure / challenges
• Responds to customer inquiries and requests: Troubleshooting, system configurations, service issues
• Demonstrates a proactive, solution-based approach to enhance client relations via meetings, calls, emails, and chat
• Constructs and manages the implementation project plan with customer counterpart, including setting and managing customer expectations based on the current state of product offerings and services
• Identifies required changes in client's business processes and supports process change management
• Understands client's data situation, develops blueprint for future state data management and works on implementation of new data processes
• Performs analysis of client data to determine parameter requirements for application's setup, including ETL and processing of data, as needed
• Works with the Data Engineering, DevOps, and Product teams to implement requirements
Application Delivery, Implementation, Training, and Support
• Leads and oversees deployment of the software, configures the software to client's needs
• Provides guidance to BCG case teams, client's business users and IT team to enable them to roll out, operate, monitor, and maintain the application
• Collaborates with GAMMA Retail Catalyst technical teams, application software vendors and other resources to diagnose and resolve application's technical and/or non-technical problems, bugs, performance, and other issues
• Collaborates with internal colleagues to construct appropriate training and support plans for the continuation of the customer’s users and deliverables after the implementation goes into production
• Works on development of application user guides and other application related materials
• Documents, tracks, and monitors application's bugs, problems, and issues to ensure timely resolution
• Performs quality control tests and keeps logs of problems, issues, changes, and future enhancements
• Tracks project progress against agreed to KPIs and any contractual obligations
• Provides product feedback to development teams
Other
• Performs other projects and duties as assigned or required
• Ability to travel up to 80% in a given week for periods of time depending on the supported products and implementation/support requirements

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
• Deep experience in brick-and-mortar Retail organizations (e.g. merchandizing, pricing, analytics, etc.)
• Advanced degree with strong academic achievements in business management, engineering, mathematics or similar
• Experience in areas such as data and / or analytics-related work, data management, end user training on data management / insights generation from data / software applications, end user support, or related activities
• Preferred customer support experience in a SaaS environment or technology industry
• Knowledge in the following fields, technologies, and tools:
• Skills in interpreting data and generating business insights from data
• Interest and ability to learn data management tools such as Alteryx, SQL, DataIKU, etc.
• Knowledge of R-script and/or Python
• MS Excel
• MS PowerPoint

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.
Key Competencies
Customer and business focus
• A passion for customer success and support is essential
• Interest in Technology and being able to learn quickly regarding tech-heavy topics and tools
• Able to adjust approach to effectively interact with customers at all organizational and technical levels
• Focus on excellent customer service and user needs; willingness to go above and beyond to deliver results
• Able to confidently make decisions and escalate issues and decisions when appropriate
• Flexibility and openness to ask for help when needed
Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Fluent written and spoken English
• Able and willing to give and receive honest, balanced feedback
Problem solving, analytical skills and decision making
• Bright, ambitious, solution-oriented self-starter
• Able to effectively handle difficult and stressful situations with poise, tact and patience, while demonstrating a sense of urgency
• Able to anticipate, identify, and solve critical problems
• Flexible, self-motivated, and proactive out-of-the-box and critical thinker
Work management, organization and planning
• Excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail; efficient time management; able to prioritize work effectively
• Independently and proactively communicates issues, priorities, and objectives
• Able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, demanding environment
Values and ethics
• Demonstrates competence and character that inspires trust
• Ability to respect all BCG and client information as personal and confidential
Work environment
• Able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment and to interpret rules and guidelines flexibly to enhance the business in keeping with BCG’s values and culture
• The ideal candidate must understand that client demands aren't always between 9-5pm and be available / flexible where necessary
• Experience working successfully within a complex matrix structured organization
• Able to understand and manage complex reporting relationships and incorporate multiple labor laws and cultures

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
We are looking for someone who will conduct data profiling, develop rules to measure data quality, perform business impact analysis, and collaborate with Data Maintenance Leads. Is that sounds like a great work opportunity for you? If yes, apply to this position and join to our new department

Service > Strategic Business Architecture > Information Operations

At Vestas, "data" has been identified as a key asset in improving its future growth and realizing its vision of being the "global leader in sustainable energy". To support this vision, you will have an important part in operationalizing data quality management and improvement activities to optimize data quality levels and raise the value and utilization of information from which Vestas makes informed and strategic decisions

Responsibilities
• Perform data profiling, develop approved set of data quality rules / requirements, and assess against these rules to accurately measure data quality levels across various dimensions... (completeness, accuracy, timeliness)
• Meet with information consumers / customers to understand their pain points of poor data and perform business impact analysis
• Creatively monitor and analyze data quality across various objects, prioritize data errors, and decide on disposition according to magnitude and business relevance
• Notify operations of data quality events to correct data errors. Effectively collaborate with DMLs and data suppliers to understand root causes and implement corrective action plans to permanently eliminate issues
• Provide requirement inputs for the development of the Data Quality Monitoring System (dashboards, scorecards, rules, and workflows)
• Administer the data catalog platform including provision of access rights and response to data governance issues

Qualifications
• Bachelor's or master's degree in data science, data analytics, information management, statistics or similar
• Experience in data science / analytics with additional experience in quality management / engineering or continuous improvement methods
• Experience with PowerBI including data modelling, visualization and writing DAX expressions
• Knowledge about SAP
• A high proficiency in written and spoken English

Competencies
• Be excited for engaging with business, technical and IT colleagues
• Have a professional mindset and an enthusiasm for delivering high quality
• Be self-motivated and possess an scientific mindset with a problem-solving approach
• Have innovative communication and Client management skills

What We Offer

We are a team of skilled and committed colleagues, who are enthusiastic about wind energy. We work in a modularized setup where you will be a part of a project team and contribute to the process within your area of expertise. You will have the opportunity to develop a career in a global company within a very exciting industry that is constantly expanding. Together with our customers, Vestas' more than 29.000 employees are bringing the world sustainable energy solutions to power a bright future

Working from home 2 days per week is possible. Benefits such us private healthcare, life insurance, multisport card are included

Additional Information

Primary work location: Szczecin, Poland

You can apply online by clicking on the "Apply Online" button at the top or bottom of this page

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings

title: Data Analyst, Delegated Authority CoE
description:
What will your essential responsibilities include?
• Performing accurate and timely analysis and reconciliation of financial statements received from third parties containing premium and claims information
• Processing third party data into internal systems.
• Liaising with internal and external parties in a confident, timely and accurate manner.

• Maintaining a good awareness of relevant regulatory requirements.
• Analyzing Gaps in received bordereaux against Lloyds, AXA XL and other required standards.
• Mapping bordereau and uploading to bordereau systems.
• Automating, enhancing and improving existing processes/tools.
• Adapting and working under pressure in order to successfully meet deadlines.
• Prioritising your workload effectively.
• Providing regular status updates to management.
•... Perform other ad hoc duties as required by management.

We're looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
• Education: educated to degree level, or equivalent through relevant work experience

• Excellent data processing skills.
• Computer literate including Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other commonly used software.

title: Financial Data Analyst, Poland
description:
We are Baltic Assist – experts in finding creative ways to expand the local job market and provide new, exciting opportunities for the best talent. Built on core values like transparency and innovation, our team is constantly working on making Baltic Assist the top choice when it comes to your career.

If you have good analytical skills and can consider yourself an innovative, driven, and passionate finance professional - we are looking for you to join the Baltic Assist team and work with an enterprise intelligence company. They help organizations accelerate data-informed business decisions by providing unique machine-learning-powered data and analytics platforms.
How you'll spend your day
• Finding, analyzing, systematizing information to cover the data points required for a full profile: legal name and ownership type; company activity, products, and services; date of foundation; employee numbers; locations; key people; competitors; funding and investor information.

You'll be successful if you have
• Strong computer skills.
• Good command of written and spoken English.
• Strong writing skills.
• Ability to work independently, with little supervision and tight deadlines.
• Understanding of financial statements and financial indicators.
• Resilience to monotonous tasks.
We offer

• Personal and professional development.
• Great chance to climb career ladders.
• Respectful communication and exchanging of ideas.
• Opportunity to work with international companies

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
AWS (nice to have)
Data modeling (regular)
Business Analysis (advanced)
Analytical Thinking (advanced) StepStone: Founded in 1996, part of the Axel Springer SE group, is one of the most successful international digital recruiting businesses. We operate over 54 job boards with over 67 million visits per month and employ over 3,500 people in more than 20 countries. We deliver the best experience to our candidates and the recruiters we work with from small local players to big global brands across the job industry.

We at Stepstone are disrupting the global job market. Our products are digitalising the marketplace, setting new digital recruiting standards. How? By leveraging Artificial Intelligence to transform finding jobs and finding talent into a gratifying experience. Simple. Human. Intuitive. This is StepStone. Our 1000 people-strong, global Product, Technology and Marketing teams are empowered to work on complex challenges that will make a significant difference across the world... We're a positive force for good with our mission being to get the right people into the right jobs. We do this by making sure people are at the heart of our strategy as well as making sure people are at the heart of the companies we work with. When we talk about people, we mean that we celebrate the differences, the diversity and the diverse perspectives that make communities both successful and wonderful. We strive towards creating an inclusive culture, a truly diverse organisation and an environment that is reflective of a flexible way of working for everyone. We are keen to spread the net far and wide to reach out to candidates from diverse backgrounds. If you're an unconventional candidate or you feel like you're under-represented within the industry then we'd love to hear from you.
Project description:

Successful candidate will join Data Governance Team. The team mission is to improve the effi ciency, increase the profitability and lower the business risks of the company by ensuring that the highest (possible, reasonable) quality data is delivered.

• Experience in Business and Software Analysis
• Logical Data Modelling
Technologies that are nice to have:
• Data Governance and related tools
• Metadata Management
• Regulatory and Compliance (incl. GDPR) requirements

• AWS cloud services
We are waiting for your CV if:
• You are interested in increasing value and understanding of data
• You want to build an industry leading data governance framework
• You possess Stakeholder engagement skills
In this role you will:
• Serve as a point of contact for governance and metadata management
• Create, develop and maintain standards & guidelines
• Elicit and prioritize needs for Data Management & Governance tools
• Build awareness in the organization
• Help to understand the value of DG
• Monitor, help to improve (meta)data quality
• Support other DG roles: stewards, owners etc.

English (junior)

Over the last year, Webinterpret has grown by more than 300% and it shows no signs of a slowdown. HOW DO WE WORK:

title: Processing Services Analyst
description:
It's fun to work at a company where people truly believe in what they are doing

Job Description:

The Processing Services Analyst works as a member of the Operations team in Wroclaw within Epiq's North American Legal Solutions department. The Analyst role is to provide technical support for the full lifecycle of the electronic discovery reference model (EDRM) including ingestion of data, quality control, document production and document review projects. The position will require attention to detail, multi-tasking, analytical skills, as well as someone who works well in a team. The candidate must be able to work under the pressure of strict deadlines on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.

Working schedule:

Monday - Friday 15:00-23:00 CET

or

Tuesday - Saturday 15:00 - 23:00 CET

Responsibilities
• Utilize proprietary and 3rd party eDiscovery software applications for electronic discovery and data recovery processes.
• Load, Process and Search client data in many... different file formats.
• Conducting relevant searches of electronic data using proprietary tools.
• Work closely with team members to troubleshoot data issues (prior to escalation to operations senior management and/or IT/Development), research software and/or techniques to solve problems, and carry out complex data analysis tasks.
• Providing end user and technical documentation and training for applications supported.
• Communicate and collaborate with other company departments.
• Generate reports from various database platforms for senior management.
• Generating written status reports to clients, managers, and project managers.
• Working closely with internal departments on streamlining processes and development of proprietary tools

Requirements
• Solid understanding of Windows and all MS Office applications is required.
• Basic UNIX skills, understanding of hardware, networking, and delimited files would be an advantage.
• Experience with database applications and knowledge of litigation support software is desirable.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are essential for this role.
• Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, follow detailed instructions and meet established deadlines.
• A self-starter with ability to visualize data and software behavior and coordinate the two.
• Fluency in English (verbal and written) is required
• Bachelor's degree or final year student, preferably in computer/technical but not limited to.

#LI-DNI

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us

It is Epiq's policy to comply with all applicable equal employment opportunity laws by making all employment decisions without unlawful regard or consideration of any individual's race, religion, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, transgender status, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, marital status, age, national origin, genetic information, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, veteran or family status or any other basis protected by applicable national, federal, state, provincial or local law. Epiq's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on any of these impermissible bases, as well as any bases or grounds protected by applicable law in each jurisdiction. In addition Epiq will take affirmative action for minorities, women, covered veterans and individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. Epiq is pleased to provide such assistance and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request. Pursuant to relevant law, where applicable, Epiq will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: Senior Solution Analyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

BCG GAMMA accelerates clients' speed to insights through premium software and data solutions. We define and develop products to deliver unique offerings and services that redefine the client experience in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. We are designers, data engineers, data scientists, product managers, and software technologists aligned around a common goal — to extend and amplify BCG's consulting impact through powerful digital solutions.

This individual will be working with industry agnostic tools developed and commercialized by BCG for clients and consulting teams. These products are geared towards large scale transformation at our clients and can span a variety of topics and technical stacks. You will join the Software delivery team in the Product Delivery & Support - function to support the implementation and maintenance of these products for our clients.

The person in the Senior Solution Analyst role will play a critical role in delivering and... supporting BCG's client-facing strategic workforce planning product, SWP by BCG. Candidates should possess an entrepreneurial drive and have demonstrated experience in client service.

The main responsibility will be working directly with client teams and consulting teams, plus plus support strategic business initiatives, and advanced capability & functionality building for the internal team, taking direction from senior business leaders managing the product and senior stakeholders in the relevant PA(s).
• Works together with BCG consulting teams and clients to understand client's processes, business requirements, and data structure / challenges
• Building a deep understanding of BCG topic methodology (SWP) and is able to proactively apply methodology in a given situation
• Onboard & train clients and project teams on the product.
• Configure and set up the software to client's needs.
• Looks for opportunities to continuously improve our services and offering
• Responds to client inquiries and requests: Troubleshooting, software configurations, service issues
• Works closely with Senior solution delivery members, BCG case teams, client's business users and IT team to enable them to roll out, operate, monitor, and maintain the application
• Documents, tracks, and monitors application's bugs, problems, and issues to ensure timely resolution

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Providing targeted support to case teams/clients
• Acts as the main point of contact for multiple subscription clients. Maintain client satisfaction & Promotes Customer Loyalty
• Builds Trust and Transparency with Clients, and act as customer advocate within the product team.
• Owns product delivery and works with case & clients teams in delivering SWP over the complete life cycle. Including tool configurations as well as setting and managing client expectations
• Works together with the BCG case team, BCG's clients, and SWP Topic experts to understand client's processes, business requirements, and delivery program specifics requirements
• Support SWP projects: ability to manage complex client situations and lead resolution towards mutual success and partnership
• Delivers positive outcomes for client stakeholders through proactive communication, orchestration of the right internal resources.
• Supports workshops with clients & BCG case teams as needed during the delivery program
• Introduce new releases/features to the clients, while ensuring clients maximize value from the product use.

Supports broader commercial agenda of the solution
• Represents SWP internally and externally including client demos, presentations at topic area meetings and similar forums, etc.
• Builds deep client relationships to support positive future commercial outcomes for our major products/solutions and the larger BCG client service business
• Build strong relationships with CT leadership for them to be strong advocates for SWP and create further staffing opportunities
• Provides post-case support and counsel as part of overall solution service model
• Supports business development efforts through strong awareness of client needs & demonstrated expertise in the solution
• Works closely with the Product Leadership team, topic area team and key BCG stakeholders on proposal support and associated business development activities including strategic initiatives, advanced analytics, data/ AI capability building, and thought leadership incorporation into the product

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
• Bachelor's degree in engineering, mathematics or other related field required; advanced Degree preferred
• SaaS experience of about 4-6 years in a client service environment required, ideally in the consulting industry.
• Deep data analytics skills & capability with solid problem-solving approach to "connect the dots" through leveraging data analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau) with no/minimal supervision from senior colleagues for case/client support work or for product implementation
• Able to adapt communication style to multiple stakeholders and cultures as part of a global team and support product communications (demo, in PowerPoint and directly in proposal pitches etc)
• Experience in software configuration/setup/admin experience is a nice to have
• Deliver ad-hoc requests from case or proposal teams to leverage (benchmarking, market insights, internal/external) data/databases (with no/very limited senior guidance)
• Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment

Good to have:
• Exposure & knowledge of setting up data transformation tool/pipelines.
• Proficient German Speaker.

YOU'LL WORK WITH
• Client & Case teams
• Client Success team
• Reporting & Data Analytics team
• Product and Infra Support team
• Helpdesk Team
• Product engineering teams
• Delivery and product leadership

title: Process Mining Manager
description:
Meet the CFO&EV Process Mining team

With the emergence of AI-based technologies, a new era of digital transformation has started. Companies use data analytics to accelerate their operations, make better decisions and provide higher quality service to their customers. To reap these benefits, they are looking for experts that will help them leverage the potential of data available in their information systems. That's where we come in with Process Mining.

What will you do?
Although no two days at Accenture are the same, as a Manager/ Senior Manager in the CFO&EV - Process Mining Team you will support all the phases of Process Mining projects, from concept to implementation
Your key areas of responsibility will include:
• Leading end-to-end Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
• Playing a key role in Accenture's Process Mining capability development
• Engaging and leading client conversations, leading workshops and presenting to client stakeholders in... management reviews, steercos
• Driving continuous improvement with regards to Process Mining methodology, tools, practices
• Leading the solution design and implementation aspects of engagement(s) ensuring high quality within constraints of time and budget
• Advising on Operating Model for Process Mining capability

title: IT Data Transfer
description:
We are looking for Data Analyst support to join our client's team. If you love to play with numbers and draw valuable feedback from them,. in a team you feel a leader and have leadership skills - we are probably looking for you

If you already have experience in a similar position, we'd love to get to know you better. We look forward to receiving your resume.

Check below what we offer and what we expect in this position.

title: HR Data Governance
description:
HR Data Governance & Analytics Senior SpecialistMiejsce pracy: KrakówYour responsibilities
• Consulting, developing, implementing and overseeing all Data Governance related projects and initiatives promoting data excellence in the organization.
• Champion the use of data to drive decision making and perform data quality monitoring, analysis and measurement
• Execute on action plans, communications and stakeholder management to advise on how to better maintain data and execute to global standards
• Consult and advise on continuous improvement opportunities tied to Workday configuration and HR Operating model to solution areas of opportunity
• Develop one time approaches and ongoing processes that enable data accuracy and accountability for aligned support model and global roles (create and manage defensive queries)
• Act as a trusted advisor and partner for global stakeholders, including People Organization, Talent Acquisition, Finance, Corporate Systems (participate in global... projects)
• Respond to queries related to HR Data quality from other functional teams
Our requirements
• Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent work experience required
• Minimum 3 years of relevant experience (e.g. Data Governance, HR Operations, Line HR, HRIT, Finance)
• Strong understanding of Workday HCM and/ or Finance preferred
• Advanced Excel skills
• Advanced analytical, technical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication and organizational skills
• Able to work independently with limited supervision
What we offer
• In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two "Global Wellbeing Days" each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself.
• We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working
• Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.
• We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on
• Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Benefits
• private medical care
• life insurance
• remote work opportunities
• integration events
• dental care
• corporate sports team
• corporate library
• no dress code

Overview

HR Data Governance & Analytics Senior Specialist is a key member of the Global Data Governance Team, partnering closely with the People Organization, Talent Acquisition, Corporate Systems to perform critical work supporting Aon's data governance programs and projects, as well as data analytics requirements.
How this opportunity is different

As part of our team, you will have a real impact on improving our data structures and processes, solving problems and be involved in global HR related projects. This is an opportunity for resourceful people who are able to take initiative and come up with solutions.
Aon

Aon is in the business of better decisions

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed

title: Business Analyst in Global KYC Remediation Data Integrity and...
description:
We are looking for you if:
• You have minimum of 2 years of working experience as a Business Analyst and minimum 2 years of working experience with Anti-Money Laundering and you are familiar with requirements arising from EU KYC / AML Regulations, e.g. 4th and 5th EU AMLD,
• You have experience in change projects/initiatives related to Post Transaction Monitoring.
• You have 2 years of working experience in analysing and reporting on the data controls or working on scenarios where data points are analysed across end-to-end lineage
• You have experience in the area(s) of multidisciplinary complex deliveries with a track record of fast learning in the area of KYC Compliance,
• You have working experience with concepts of the inherent and residual risk, Risk Based Approach, and risk appetite.
• You are fluent in English
• You can establish plans to determine tasks, priorities, and timelines and identifying the resources needed to achieve goals.
• You s how openness to change and altering... behaviours in order to work effectively when faced with new information, a changing situation and/or environment
• You have an a bility to identify problems, analysing key information and making connections, in order to find appropriate solutions

You'll get extra points for :
• Master's or Bachelor's degree,
• Experience and affinity with working together in IT and solution-build driven teams,
• Strong focus on understanding the regulatory and business requirements and supportive facts and data to build the target operating model design in line with INGs ambitions,
• Knowledge of domestic and international payment flows like SWIFT and SEPA

Your responsibilities:
• Provide E2E Data Continuous Control Monitoring reports that support insight in existing residual risk per specific country/business line and register the gaps and issues as required.
• Perform and report on existing automated & continuous data checks and controls & residual risk assessment
• Consult and lead on design of data controls where they are missing or are sub-standard effectiveness.
• Advise and align with our Break Assessment and LBE teams on data completeness and corrections remediation approach
• Contribute to structural TM/CDD/Screening framework improvements by sharing lessons learned (and solutions) produced through findings of data completeness and correctness, preventive and detective controls, disseminating knowledge with stakeholders that leverage same data points.

Information about the squad :

As part of ING's Global KYC organisation, the Remediation pillar leads remediations of transaction monitoring, CDD and screening, in order to protect ING from integrity risk.

The Remediation Pillar has central teams in The Netherlands and Poland, as well as Hub teams in Poland, Slovakia and The Philippines. Our teams cover Break Assessment, Lookbacks, Data Control and Process & Capabilities

title: Agile Business Analyst
description:
PROJECT INFORMATION:
• Industry: Finance / Banking
• Location: Warsaw, City Center (hybrid model)
• Project language: English / Polish
• Project length: Long-term cooperation
• Start: ASAP
• Assignment type: B2B or UoP

Your primary tasks and responsibilities will include:
• Being a driver in implementing a data-driven approach in organisation, where they make data transparent and support programs and domains to make decisions based on data
• Cooperating closely with agile coaches, product manager, RTEs, development managers, product owners and scrum masters
• Maintaining, improving and developing new Power BI reports and dashboards in very close interaction with stakeholders
• Being involved in moving current SQL Server setup to an Azure setup in cooperation with BI area
• Being a part of "Agile Delivery and Planning" area
• Maintaining, improving and developing current Power BI reports and dashboards
• Supporting and implementing a data-driven approach
• Being a part of the project... that migrate from current SQL setup to Azure (internal Datawarehouse)

Requirements:
• Minimum 4 years' experience as a business analyst using and developing BI solutions in an agile company (created in BI tools available on the market like: Tableau, Power BI, Qlikview, SAP BP or other )
• Ability to identify requirements and needs directly in an outgoing way in dialogue with various internal stakeholders
• A lean/agile mindset
• Skills for data analysis and ability to use the skills as improvement drivers
• Ability to explain complex things in a simple and understandable way
• Strong understanding of agile project life cycle
• Preferably an educational background at master's level within finance or IT

WE OFFER:
• Challenging international projects in a Scandinavian business culture
• Long-term cooperation
• Transparently built relations based on trust and fair play
• Flexible working hours
• Co-financed benefits: Medicover card, Multisport card
